intro: Pisum sativum var. patris, commonly known as the garden pea, is a variety of the pea plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and clusters of small, pod-like fruits that contain several edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in cool climates with well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and the leaves are compound, consisting of three leaflets. This variety is widely cultivated for its nutritional seeds, which are rich in protein and fiber.
